titleStmt.title: The west-country maids advice; Here is a song I send to you, fair maidens every one; and you may say that it is true, when I am dead and gone. To the tune of, Hey boys, up go we.
titleStmt.author: Bowne, Tobias.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball, near the Hospital-gate, in West-Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Fair maids draw near to me a while ..."
Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.

place.placeName: the Golden-Ball, near the Hospital-gate, in West-Smithfield
